bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [26 August 1868]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: Review corrections and notes; encoded illegible word rectoning; added note on housebuilding loan.
corrected date format in title; added call no., annotations
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p: i recieved received your letter yesterday as usual it was all right and am glad to hear you are feeling pretty well and every thing goes on pretty well with you you are so attached to washington Washington i dont don't beleive believe you ever would be contented any where else i dont don't wonder at it for i think you have more true friends there than any other place) i mean those not related to you of course) i suppose it makes you feel awkard awkward to go to mrMr. Oconors O'Connor's their not being friendly and you being friendly to both but when they move it will be different its it's very disagreable disagreeable to live in one house and not be on speaking terms i should think the oconors O'Connor's was the last people to fall out with) well Walt here we are yet in the same old place but i doo do want to get out of it very much indeed there is so many children and not the best i ever see but a continual traveling up and down from morning till night

one good thing their dog is dead he filld the house with fleas so maybe well we'll get clear of them now) georgeGeorge says we must stay here till the 1 of october October and then he see what arrangements he can make with smith to take the house all himself and then we shall move there this winter i shall be glad enoughf enough maybee maybe they will settle it up before i told georgeGeorge i wanted to move before you came home but walterWalter dear if it suits you better to come before that time you must come but i thought i should be so lonesome when i got away from this rabble that i should want you to come then and stay your full month) georgeGeorge has been to florence Florence to the foundry to get some big pipe they fell short and he dont don't have much to doo do now he talks of going up on the island for a day or two) florence Florence is the foundry where jeffJeff has his pipe made when georgeGeorge got there Jeffs Jeff's inspector was out gunning georgeGeorge left word for him to come to the hotel it was some pipe that jeffJeff had they wanted for this main so when the young man came they told him mrMr. whitmanWhitman wanted to see he was quite alarmed he thought of course it was jeffJeff georgeGeorge thought he was very glad as he dident didn't care for jeffJeff to find him out gunning) georgeGeorge has got a draft from jeffJeff for 510 doll dollars and got the money without any trouble) now walterWalter dear dont don't wait till we move if it suits you i make a good deal of rectonengreckoning of your coming

postscript.p: i feel pretty well at present
